derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French tanesie, probably from medieval Latin athanasia 'immortality', from Greek

means.word_mean: 1. common perennial aromatic herb native to Eurasia having buttonlike yellow flower heads and bitter-tasting pinnate leaves sometimes used medicinally
